verses.text: And God said unto Jacob , Arise , go up to Beth-el , and dwell there: and make there an altar unto God , that appeared unto thee when thou fleddest from the face of Esau thy brother.
Then Jacob said unto his household , and to all that \add were\add* with him, Put away the strange gods that \add are\add* among you , and be clean , and change your garments :
And let us arise , and go up to Beth-el ; and I will make there an altar unto God , who answered me in the day of my distress , and was with me in the way which I went.

And they gave unto Jacob all the strange gods which \add were\add* in their hand , and \add all their\add* earrings which \add were\add* in their ears ; and Jacob hid them under the oak which \add was\add* by Shechem.
And they journeyed : and the terror of God was upon the cities that \add were\add* round about them, and they did not pursue after the sons of Jacob. \p
¶ So Jacob came to Luz , which \add is\add* in the land of Canaan , that \add is\add*, Beth-el , he and all the people that \add were\add* with him.

And he built there an altar , and called the place El-beth-el : because there God appeared unto him, when he fled from the face of his brother.\f + \fr 35.7 \ft El-beth-el: that is, The God of Beth-el\f*
But Deborah Rebekah’s nurse died , and she was buried beneath Beth-el under an oak : and the name of it was called Allon-bachuth.\f + \fr 35.8 \ft Allon-bachuth: that is, The oak of weeping\f* \p
¶ And God appeared unto Jacob again, when he came out of Padan-aram , and blessed him.
And God said unto him, Thy name \add is\add* Jacob : thy name shall not be called any more Jacob , but Israel shall be thy name : and he called his name Israel.
And God said unto him, I \add am\add* God Almighty : be fruitful and multiply ; a nation and a company of nations shall be of thee, and kings shall come out of thy loins ;
And the land which I gave Abraham and Isaac , to thee I will give it , and to thy seed after thee will I give the land.
And God went up from him in the place where he talked with him.
And Jacob set up a pillar in the place where he talked with him, \add even\add* a pillar of stone : and he poured a drink offering thereon, and he poured oil thereon.
And Jacob called the name of the place where God spake with him, Beth-el. \p
¶ And they journeyed from Beth-el ; and there was but a little way to come to Ephrath : and Rachel travailed , and she had hard labour.\f + \fr 35.16 \ft a little…: Heb. a little piece of ground\f*
And it came to pass, when she was in hard labour , that the midwife said unto her, Fear not; thou shalt have this son also.

And it came to pass, as her soul was in departing , (for she died ) that she called his name Ben-oni : but his father called him Benjamin.\f + \fr 35.18 \ft Ben-oni: that is, The son of my sorrow\f*\f + \fr 35.18 \ft Benjamin: that is, The son of the right hand\f*
And Rachel died , and was buried in the way to Ephrath , which \add is\add* Beth-lehem.
And Jacob set a pillar upon her grave : that \add is\add* the pillar of Rachel’s grave unto this day. \p
¶ And Israel journeyed , and spread his tent beyond the tower of Edar.
And it came to pass, when Israel dwelt in that land , that Reuben went and lay with Bilhah his father’s concubine : and Israel heard \add it\add*. Now the sons of Jacob were twelve :
The sons of Leah ; Reuben , Jacob’s firstborn , and Simeon , and Levi , and Judah , and Issachar , and Zebulun :
The sons of Rachel ; Joseph , and Benjamin :
And the sons of Bilhah , Rachel’s handmaid ; Dan , and Naphtali :
And the sons of Zilpah , Leah’s handmaid ; Gad , and Asher : these \add are\add* the sons of Jacob , which were born to him in Padan-aram. \p
¶ And Jacob came unto Isaac his father unto Mamre , unto the city of Arbah , which \add is\add* Hebron , where Abraham and Isaac sojourned.
And the days of Isaac were an hundred and fourscore years.
And Isaac gave up the ghost , and died , and was gathered unto his people , \add being\add* old and full of days : and his sons Esau and Jacob buried him.
